Description: 19th century wooden box containing: (1) parts of female Egyptian mummy unwrapped and dissected by A B Granville in 1821; (2) parts of a 'North African' mummy; (3) Four human foetuses, plus four arms and a leg of others, used by A B Granville as subjects for experimental mummification in 1822 and 1824.
Bibliographic references: Fletcher, Antoine and Hill 2014 / Regarding the Dead: Human Remains in the British Museum (p.108, pl.6, p.109, p.110, table 1)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville
